required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Platelet Rich Plasma (PRP) One-Shot Injection For Supraspinatus Tendinosis
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Results Of Platelet Rich Plasma (PRP) One-Shot Injection For Supraspinatus Tendinosis, Our Experience At Short-Term Follow Up

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Ospedaliero-Universitaria Consorziale Policlinico di Bari

clinical_study.source: Azienda Ospedaliero-Universitaria Consorziale Policlinico di Bari

brief_summary.textblock:
It was conducted a prospective study with a series of 50 patients treated with PRP one-shot injection in patient affected by Supraspinatus Tendinosis. One independent observer performed clinical and functional evaluations at T0 (recruitment), T1 (one month after the injection), T2 (three months after the last injection) and T3 (six months after the last injection).
Constant Score, The Disabilites of the Arm,Shoulder and Hand Score (DASH) And Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) were administered at each evaluation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0; Month 1; Month 3; Month 6 (after the injection)
primary_outcome.description: The shoulder pain was quantified using the Visual Analogic Scale ranging from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst imaginable pain).

arm_group.arm_group_label: patients treated by one-shot PRP injection

intervention.description: A single injection of PRP (7% concentrate) ml 4 was made in the Supraspinatus tendon and in the Subacromial space under ultrasound guidance.
intervention.arm_group_label: patients treated by one-shot PRP injection

study_pop.textblock: Fifty (50) patients referring to the Orthopaedic and Trauma Unit of the local University Hospital between January 2018 and July 2020 with Supraspinatus tendinosis were prospectively recruited.

facility.name: AOUC Policlinico di Bari - UOC Ortopedia e Traumatologia
